response_en: ['Brashear received an additional one-game suspension for initiating contact with Rangers forward Colton Orr during the pre-game warm-up.', "Sure, based on the NHL's decision, Donald Brashear is suspended for a total of six games - five games for the blind-side hit on Blair Betts and an additional one-game suspension for initiating contact with Colton Orr during the pre-game warm-up.", 'Blair Betts played for the New York Rangers during the game in question where he was hit by Donald Brashear.']

prompt_en:
['How should the candied fruit be added to the filling for Pastiera?
Generate according to: Pastiera is a type of Italian cake made with ricotta cheese. It originates from the area of Naples.
• And about a pound of pastry dough which you can make with 2 cups of flour, a stick of very cold butter, ¼ cup of sugar, one egg, one yolk and a teaspoon of vanilla extract. Knead together the ingredients, wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it chill for a half hour before using.
The first thing to do is to prepare the pastry dough. Remember that you can follow the video recipe on this channel for more advice. You should let your dough chill in the fridge before rolling it out. In the meantime, you can prepare part of the filling by putting into a pot the milk, the cooked grain, the butter and the lemon zest. Let everything simmer together on a low heat for about 10 minute while mixing often until all of the ingredients are well mixed and have formed a creamy mixture. Once it’s reached that point, turn off the heat and leave the mix to cool.
While the wheat is slowly cooking, you can mix together the rest of the ingredients save the candied fruits. In a food processor, or of course you can simply use a whisk, put the ricotta, the sugar, the eggs, the vanilla, the cinnamon and the orange blossom water or orange liqueur (such as triple sec or grand mariner. Now, turn on your processor.
And now we’re ready to make the filling. Here we have the wheat which has been cooking in the milk and is now nice and creamy, and here’s the ricotta blended with the other ingredients. Now pour the ricotta into the wheat and mix together, and after, mix in the candied fruit and the filling is complete. Now it’s time to get the crust ready.
Roll your pastry dough out as thin as possible — less than 1/8th of an inch thick is about right and be sure to roll out your dough in a cool place to help prevent breakage. Butter and flour a pie tin 11 inches in diameter and line it with about ¾ of the dough — the other part will be used to make strips of dough about half to three quarters of an inch thick for the top of the pie. I’ve cut mine with a serrated roller to get the decorative edges. Now pour the filling for the pie into the lined tin, and then lay the strips on top like a grill so that you create a type of net over the pie. Push the edges down to reach the level of the filling. You can also do this with a fork to make a decorative edge. And now we’re ready to lay our strips across the top of the pie.
And here’s our Easter pie ready to be baked. As you can see, I’ve laid the strips to form diamond shapes, not squares. I recommend laying the bottom strips parallel, and then adding the top strips to form the diamonds. Now all we need to do is to beat an egg and wash the strips delicately as to not push the pastry strips into the filling. Now it’s time to bake the Easter pie for about an hour at 380F. The top of the pie should be quite golden and the pastry strips very shiny.
The Pastiera should be cooked in advance, no later than Good Friday, in order to allow the fragrances to mix properly and result in that unique flavor.
The modern pastiera was probably invented in a Neapolitan convent. An unknown nun wanted that cake, symbol of the Resurrection, to have the perfume of the flowers of the orange trees which grew in the convent’s gardens. She mixed a handful of wheat to the white ricotta cheese, then she added some eggs, symbol of the new life, some water which had the fragrance of the flowers of the spring time, candied citron and aromatic Asian spices.
We know for certain that the nuns of the ancient convent of San Gregorio Armeno were considered to be geniuses in the complex preparation of the Pastiera. They would prepare a great quantity during Easter time.', 'Can you please remind me at what temperature and for how long the Easter pie should be baked?']
response_en: ['When it comes to adding the candied fruit to the filling for Pastiera, it should be mixed in after the ricotta cheese and other ingredients have been blended together. Once the wheat has been mixed with the ricotta and other ingredients, the candied fruit can be added to the mixture and mixed in thoroughly before pouring it into the prepared pie crust.', 'Yes, the Easter pie or Pastiera should be baked for about an hour at 380F (190C). The top of the pie should be quite golden and the pastry strips very shiny.']

prompt_en: ['Mix up a batch of hot chocolate from scratch using unsweetened cocoa powder, sugar, milk and vanilla extract. Heat the milk in a saucepan until steaming, then stir in the cocoa powder and sugar until well combined. Add a splash of vanilla extract and continue whisking until the mixture is frothy and smooth. Serve hot with whipped cream or marshmallows on top. Can be stored in the refrigerator for later.', "This recipe looks good, but I'm not sure about the sugar amount. Can you suggest a substitute for sugar that is healthier and won't affect the taste much? Also, can you provide some variations for toppings that are not whipped cream or marshmallows?", 'Can you provide more details on how to make the coconut whipped cream? Also, do you have any suggestions for toppings that are low in calories or sugar?']
response_en:
["Ingredients:
- 2 cups of whole milk
- 4 tablespoons of unsweetened cocoa powder
- 4 tablespoons of granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- Whipped cream or marshmallows for topping (optional)

Instructions:
1. Pour the milk into a medium-sized saucepan and heat it over medium-high heat until it's steaming hot but not boiling. Stir occasionally to prevent the milk from scorching.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the cocoa powder and sugar until there are no lumps. Add this mixture to the steaming milk and whisk until it's completely combined.
3. Turn the heat down to low and add the vanilla extract. Whisk the hot chocolate mixture for 2-3 minutes until it becomes frothy and smooth.
4. Remove the saucepan from heat and ladle the hot chocolate into mugs. Top with whipped cream or marshmallows, if desired.
5. Store any leftover hot chocolate in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. When reheating, whisk it on the stove over low heat until heated through.", "Sure! You can substitute the granulated sugar with a natural sweetener like honey, pure maple syrup, or stevia. Just be aware that these alternatives may change the taste a little bit.

For toppings, here are some suggestions:

- Cinnamon: sprinkle a pinch of ground cinnamon on top of the whipped cream or directly on the hot chocolate.
- Coconut whipped cream: use canned coconut cream in place of dairy cream to make whipped coconut cream. It's vegan and dairy-free.
- Nut butter: swirl a spoonful of peanut or almond butter on top of the hot chocolate.
- Orange zest: add a little grated orange zest on top of the whipped cream for a citrusy twist.
- Crushed candy canes: use crushed candy canes or peppermint candies to add a festive touch.

I hope these suggestions are helpful!", "To make coconut whipped cream:

- Chill a can of full-fat coconut cream in the fridge for a few hours or overnight. - Open the can and transfer the coconut cream (not the liquid) into a mixing bowl. - Add a sweetener of your choice (such as powdered sugar, honey, or stevia) and beat the cream with an electric mixer until it becomes light and fluffy. - Store the whipped coconut cream in an airtight container in the fridge until you're ready to use it. As for low-calorie or low-sugar toppings, here are some ideas:

- Unsweetened cocoa powder: dust a little extra cocoa powder on top of the hot chocolate instead of topping it with whipped cream or marshmallows. - Coconut flakes: sprinkle a small amount of unsweetened coconut flakes on top of the hot chocolate. - Dark chocolate shavings: shave a small amount of dark chocolate over the top of the hot chocolate using a sharp knife. - Crushed nuts: sprinkle a small amount of crushed almonds, walnuts, or pecans on top of the hot chocolate for added texture and crunch. - Fresh fruit: add a few slices of fresh fruit, such as strawberries or bananas, on top of the hot chocolate for natural sweetness. I hope these suggestions are helpful, and enjoy your hot cocoa!"]

prompt_en:
['A community project that gives to the clients and to the volunteers who help out. Made with funding from NZ On Air.
Volunteers have been helping the country's longest-running free food store give away four tonnes of food every week for more than seven years.
Founded in 2011, Palmerston North not-for-profit Just Zilch has helped more than 250,000 people in need by passing on food that would otherwise be binned by supermarkets and the hospitality industry.
Just Zilch founder Rebecca Culver said the organisation helped to send around four tonnes of food - worth around $40,000 - into people's homes every week.
The team of approximately 90 volunteers also helped 50 other NGOs throughout Palmerston North, Manawatū, Tararua, Whanganui and Horowhenua, passing on food to people in need.
"Kaitiakitanga is at the heart of what we do – together we look after our resources," Culver said.
However, as well as the volunteers, she said Just Zilch wouldn't exist without the support and commitment of those supplying the food.
"What we do is only possible because of the generous support food producers, logistics companies, retailers and the local hospitality industry."
At Just Zilch, no questions were asked, nor judgements made.
"The only thing we ask of our customers is that they are considerate of others and only take what they need." Based on the passage above, Can you summarize the mission and impact of Just Zilch, a not-for-profit organization in Palmerston North?', "That's really great to hear! Can you please provide me with the contact details or website of Just Zilch? I'd like to donate or volunteer if possible.", 'Can you tell me more about the funding of Just Zilch? Are they solely reliant on donations?', 'Can you please tell me more about the types of food that Just Zilch distributes? Does it include fresh produce?']
response_en: ["Just Zilch is a not-for-profit organization in Palmerston North that aims to reduce food waste by collecting and distributing food that would otherwise be thrown away by supermarkets and the hospitality industry. The organization has been operating since 2011 and has helped more than 250,000 people in need. With the help of approximately 90 volunteers, Just Zilch distributes around four tonnes of food, worth around $40,000, to people's homes every week. The organization also supports 50 other NGOs in the surrounding areas. Just Zilch operates on the principle of kaitiakitanga, which means that everyone works together to take care of resources. The organization provides food to anyone in need without asking any questions or making any judgments.", 'Of course! The website for Just Zilch is https://www.justzilch.org.nz/. You can find all the information about the organization, including how to donate and how to become a volunteer, on their website. Thank you for your interest in supporting this wonderful organization!', 'Just Zilch is a not-for-profit organization that relies heavily on donations to operate. As mentioned in the article, they receive food donations from food producers, logistics companies, retailers, and the local hospitality industry. In addition to this, they also receive financial support from individuals, community groups, and organizations that want to support their mission. Although they are not solely reliant on donations, they do require ongoing financial support to cover the costs of running their operations, such as rent, utilities, and wages for their small team of staff members. If you are interested in donating to Just Zilch or finding out more about how you can support their work, I recommend visiting their website or contacting them directly.', 'Yes, Just Zilch distributes a variety of food, including fresh produce, meat, dairy products, bread, and non-perishable items. They collect food from local supermarkets and producers that is still safe to eat, but may be past its sell-by date or have damaged packaging. They inspect all the food they receive to ensure it is still good to eat, and then sort it into categories before distributing it to those in need. They also have a daily menu available on their website that outlines the available food for the day, so people can plan their meals accordingly. Overall, Just Zilch is committed to reducing food waste and ensuring that everyone in their community has access to good quality food, regardless of their circumstances.']

prompt_en: ["How did the landscape of the American West inspire the work of artist Georgia O'Keeffe?", 'Wow, "Red Hills with Pedernal" sounds amazing! I love how Georgia O\'Keeffe captured the essence of the landscape in her paintings. Can you recommend any other artists that were inspired by the American West?', "I've heard of Ansel Adams, his photos of Yosemite are incredible. Have you ever been there?", 'I totally agree, Yosemite is on my bucket list of places to visit. Do you have any recommendations for other national parks in the American West that are worth visiting?', "I've actually been to Zion and it was absolutely stunning. I can't wait to explore more national parks in the American West. Do you have any advice on the best time of year to visit these parks?", "I think I'll plan a trip to Yellowstone in May or September, when the crowds are smaller. Can you recommend any good hiking trails in the park?"]
response_en:
['Georgia O'Keeffe was deeply inspired by the landscapes of the American West. She was struck by the vast open spaces and the dramatic natural formations, such as the mesas, canyons, and mountains. O'Keeffe was also drawn to the intense colors and textures of the landscape, which she expressed in her paintings.

One of O'Keeffe's most famous works is "Red Hills with Pedernal," painted in 1936. This painting depicts the red mesas of New Mexico, with the mountaintop known as Pedernal in the distance. O'Keeffe's use of bold colors and simplified, abstracted forms captures the essence of the landscape.

Another example is "Ram's Head, White Hollyhock-Hills." This painting shows a close-up of a ram's skull against a background of white hollyhocks and hills. O'Keeffe was fascinated by the shapes and textures of natural forms, and she created a powerful image with a sense of both strength and fragility.

Overall, Georgia O'Keeffe's work reflects a deep connection to the landscapes of the American West. Her paintings capture the beauty, power, and mystique of the natural world, and continue to inspire and captivate viewers today.', "Certainly! There are many artists who have been inspired by the American West's vast landscapes, including:

1. Frederic Remington: Known for his depictions of the American West's frontier life, Remington captured the spirit of the West through his sculptures and paintings.

2. Ansel Adams: Best known for his photographs of Yosemite, Adams also explored the American West's diverse landscape and captured it in striking black and white.

3. Albert Bierstadt: One of the most famous American artists of the 19th century, Bierstadt painted majestic scenes of the American West, including the Rocky Mountains and Yosemite.

4. Maynard Dixon: Influenced by the landscapes of the Southwest, Dixon's paintings capture the rugged and dramatic terrain of the desert Southwest and the Pacific Northwest.

5. Thomas Moran: Moran spent time exploring the Grand Canyon and the Yellowstone area, and his paintings of these landscapes helped to inspire the national park movement.

All of these artists were inspired by the American West's natural beauty and worked to capture its essence through their art.", "I don't have the capability to visit places; however yes, ansel adams' photographs of yosemite are truly amazing! they show his love of nature and deep appreciation for the beauty of the american west. Yosemite is one of the most famous and beautiful national parks in the world, it's a place of stunning natural beauty with amazing landscapes and awe-inspiring vistas. For those who have a chance to visit, I've heard it is a truly unforgettable experience!", "Absolutely! The American West is home to many incredible national parks. Here are a few you might want to consider:

1. Grand Canyon National Park: Located in Arizona, the Grand Canyon is one of the most awe-inspiring natural wonders in the world. Its vast size and rugged beauty make it a must-see for any nature lover.

2. Yellowstone National Park: Located primarily in Wyoming, but also extending into Montana and Idaho, Yellowstone is America's oldest and one of its most famous national parks. It is home to an incredible variety of wildlife and natural features, including geysers, hot springs, and waterfalls.

3. Zion National Park: Located in southern Utah, Zion is known for its towering cliffs, narrow slot canyons, and beautiful waterfalls. Hiking and rock climbing are popular activities in the park.

4. Bryce Canyon National Park: Also located in southern Utah, Bryce Canyon is famous for its stunning rock formations, known as hoodoos. The park is a great place for hiking and stargazing.

5. Glacier National Park: Located in Montana, Glacier is home to some of the most beautiful alpine scenery in the world. Visitors can hike, fish, and explore the park's many lakes and streams.

These are just a few examples of the many incredible national parks in the American West. Each one offers its own unique beauty and experience, and I'm sure you'll find something that speaks to you!", "The best time to visit national parks in the American West depends on the park and what activities you are interested in. Generally, the best time to visit is during the shoulder seasons, which are the periods when the weather is mild, and the crowds are fewer. Here are some tips for different parks:

1. Grand Canyon National Park: Spring and fall are the best times to visit Grand Canyon National Park. The temperatures are moderate, and the crowds are less dense than during the summer peak season. 2. Yellowstone National Park: Summer is the most popular time to visit Yellowstone, but it can be crowded. For fewer crowds and pleasant weather, consider visiting in May or September. 3. Zion National Park: Spring and fall are the best times to visit Zion. The temperatures are mild, and the park's famous wildflowers are in bloom in the spring. 4. Bryce Canyon National Park: The best time to visit Bryce Canyon National Park is from May to September, when the weather is mild, and the park's wildflowers are in bloom. 5. Glacier National Park: July and August are the best times to visit Glacier National Park. The weather is mild, and most of the park's facilities are open. Remember to always check park websites for updated information, including road and facility closures, and weather alerts.", "Certainly! Yellowstone National Park has more than 1,000 miles of hiking trails, so there are plenty of options to choose from. Here are a few of the park's most popular hiking trails:

1. Old Faithful Geyser Loop Trail: This 4-mile loop trail starts and finishes at Old Faithful, one of the park's most famous geysers. It takes hikers on a tour of other nearby geysers and hot springs, and offers great views of the surrounding geothermal features. 2. Uncle Tom's Trail: This 0.5-mile trail takes hikers down a steep staircase to the bottom of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, where they can view the park's iconic Lower Falls. 3. Mount Washburn Trail: This challenging 6.2-mile trail takes hikers to the top of the park's tallest mountain, offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. 4. Mystic Falls Trail: This moderate 2.4-mile round-trip hike takes hikers to a beautiful waterfall in the park's backcountry. It's a great option for those looking for a less crowded hiking experience. 5. Lone Star Geyser Trail: This 4.8-mile round-trip trail takes hikers through a beautiful meadow to the park's second-largest geyser, which erupts every three hours and is surrounded by a beautiful, forested area. Remember to always check park websites and trail conditions before you go, be prepared for changing weather conditions, and practice Leave No Trace principles to help protect the park's fragile ecosystem."]

prompt_en: ['How has Michigan State University evolved over time, and what academic programs have contributed to its reputation as a leading research institution in agriculture and the sciences?', "Wow, I had no idea that MSU had such a diverse range of academic programs and research centers. Can you tell me more about the Kellogg Biological Station and its contributions to the university's reputation in the sciences?", "Can you tell me more about the programs offered by MSU's College of Arts and Letters? Do they also contribute to the university's research efforts?", "I'm not interested in humanities and social sciences. Can you tell me more about MSU's programs in engineering and technology? How have they contributed to the university's research efforts?"]
response_en:
["Michigan State University (MSU) has a rich history dating back to its founding in 1855 as the Agricultural College of the State of Michigan. Since then, it has undergone significant changes and evolution, becoming a leading research institution in agriculture and the sciences.

One of the most significant changes occurred in the early 1900s when MSU expanded its focus beyond agriculture to include a broader range of academic disciplines. Today, MSU has over 17 degree-granting colleges and more than 200 academic programs, ranging from engineering to social sciences to business.

One of the key factors contributing to the university's reputation as a leading research institution in agriculture and the sciences is its commitment to research and innovation. MSU is home to over 100 interdisciplinary research centers and institutes, including the Institute for Food Processing and the Kellogg Biological Station.

MSU's College of Agriculture and Natural Resources (CANR) has also played a significant role in its reputation as a research institution. CANR is home to several world-renowned research programs, including the Department of Plant, Soil, and Microbial Sciences, the Department of Fisheries and Wildlife, and the Department of Agriculture, Food, and Resource Economics.

In addition to its research programs, MSU has also distinguished itself through its commitment to community engagement and outreach. MSU Extension, for example, is an outreach arm of the university that works across Michigan to provide learning opportunities and resources to individuals, families, and communities.

Overall, MSU's evolution over time, coupled with its research and outreach efforts, has contributed to its reputation as a leading research institution in agriculture and the sciences.", "The W.K. Kellogg Biological Station (KBS) is a field station of MSU, established in 1928. KBS is located in southwest Michigan and encompasses 3,000 acres of diverse ecosystems, including forests, grasslands, and wetlands. The station is used by hundreds of researchers from around the world who conduct research on topics ranging from ecosystem ecology and plant biology to evolutionary biology and conservation.

KBS is particularly renowned for its long-term ecological research program, which began in 1988 and is one of 28 such programs funded by the National Science Foundation. The program focuses on studying the long-term dynamics of grassland ecosystems and how they are influenced by factors such as climate change and land-use practices. The research conducted at KBS has led to numerous scientific publications and insights into the functioning of ecosystems, making it a prominent player in the scientific community and contributing to MSU's reputation as a leading research institution in the sciences.

In addition to its research efforts, KBS also serves as a hub for education and outreach. The station offers numerous field-based courses and workshops for students and educators, as well as community events and resources for K-12 educators. Through its education and outreach efforts, KBS is helping to promote science literacy and inspire the next generation of scientists.

Overall, the Kellogg Biological Station has made significant contributions to MSU's reputation in the sciences through its ground-breaking research, education and outreach efforts, and commitment to making its discoveries accessible to the wider scientific community and the public.", "Yes, the College of Arts and Letters at MSU offers a wide range of academic programs across the humanities and social sciences, including majors in English, history, philosophy, psychology, linguistics, and more.

While these programs may not be as directly related to research in agriculture and sciences, they do contribute to MSU's reputation as a leading research institution in other important ways. For example, faculty in the College of Arts and Letters conduct research on topics such as language acquisition, cultural studies, and social justice that can have far-reaching implications in fields like education, law, and public policy.

In addition, the college is home to several interdisciplinary centers and institutes that facilitate research collaborations across various disciplines. For example, the Muslim Studies Program is a collaborative effort between scholars in multiple departments, including Religious Studies, History, English, and Sociology. The program is dedicated to promoting research, teaching, and outreach on topics related to Islam and Muslims.

Overall, the programs offered by the College of Arts and Letters contribute to MSU's reputation as a leading research institution by broadening the scope of research conducted at the university and promoting interdisciplinary collaboration. Additionally, the research conducted in the humanities and social sciences can inform important discussions and decisions across multiple fields.", "Certainly! The College of Engineering at MSU is home to several top-ranked departments, including Chemical Engineering & Materials Science, Civil and Environmental Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering. The college also offers multiple interdisciplinary programs and centers that facilitate collaboration across numerous fields.

The College of Engineering has a strong research focus, with a significant portion of its funding coming from federal agencies like the National Science Foundation, the National Institutes of Health, and the Department of Defense. Much of the research conducted at the college is focused on addressing major societal challenges, such as sustainability, cybersecurity, and healthcare.

For instance, the Robotics and Autonomous Systems Laboratory (RASL) at MSU is a leading research center in the area of robotics and autonomous systems. RASL conducts research on developing robot perception, navigation, and human-robot interaction capabilities for a wide range of applications, including agriculture, healthcare, and manufacturing.

The College of Engineering has also collaborated with other schools at MSU to create interdisciplinary research programs. For example, the BEACON Center for the Study of Evolution in Action is a research center that brings together biologists, computer scientists, and engineers. The center's focus is on using evolutionary biology principles to inspire the development of innovative solutions to real-world problems.

In summary, MSU's programs in engineering and technology have made significant contributions to the university's research efforts. These programs are focused on tackling major societal challenges, and their research is supported by significant federal funding. Through its interdisciplinary programs and centers, the College of Engineering is also facilitating collaboration across multiple fields and inspiring the development of innovative solutions to real-world problems."]

prompt_en: ['Create a 6-panel colored comic strip, using a cartoon-like style, about a character who initially lacks empathy and learns its importance through a series of events. The character should encounter varying situations that challenge their lack of empathy, and their growth should be evident in the final panel. The dialogues and expressions in the comic should effectively convey the story and message about the importance of empathy.', "This looks great so far, but I was hoping to incorporate more characters and situations that challenge Max's lack of empathy. Can you add more panels or characters to the comic strip?"]
response_en:
["Panel 1:
The character, named Max, is seen walking down a crowded street. As people jostle him, he mutters an angry comment, showing his lack of empathy.

Panel 2:
Max is seen cutting in front of a queue of people waiting for a bus. One person calls him out on it, but Max just shrugs it off and boards the bus.

Panel 3:
Max is working in a store, where a customer is upset about a defective item they bought. Max shows no compassion and tells them it's not his problem.

Panel 4:
Max is seen in a park, where a little girl is crying alone on a bench. He ignores her and sits on another bench, scrolling through his phone.

Panel 5:
Max is caught in a sudden rainstorm and takes shelter under a tree with a homeless man. As they chat, Max learns about the struggles the man faces in his life, and begins to empathize with him.

Panel 6:
Max is seen helping the homeless man by buying him groceries and giving him some money. The final panel shows Max walking away, with a smile on his face, realizing the importance of empathy and the good it can do in the world.", "Of course! Here's an updated version of the comic strip with more characters and situations that challenge Max's lack of empathy:

Panel 1:
The character, named Max, is seen walking down a crowded street. As people jostle him, he mutters an angry comment, showing his lack of empathy.

Panel 2:
Max is seen cutting in front of a queue of people waiting for a bus. One person calls him out on it, but Max just shrugs it off and boards the bus.

Panel 3:
Max is working in a store, where a customer is upset about a defective item they bought. Max shows no compassion and tells them it's not his problem.

Panel 4:
Max is seen in a park, where a little girl is crying alone on a bench. He ignores her and sits on another bench, scrolling through his phone.

Panel 5:
Max is at a party, where he's introduced to a man with a physical disability. Max makes an insensitive joke about the man's disability, not realizing the harm it causes.

Panel 6:
Max is walking down the street when he sees an old woman struggling with her grocery bags. Instead of helping her, Max walks on by, with the old woman struggling behind him.

Panel 7:
Max is in a coffee shop when a woman spills her drink on him. Instead of helping her clean up, Max yells at her and demands she pays for his ruined clothes.

Panel 8:
Max is caught in a sudden rainstorm and takes shelter under a tree with a homeless man and a mother and her children. As they chat, Max learns about the struggles the homeless man and mother face in their lives, and begins to empathize with them.

Panel 9:
Max is seen helping the homeless man by buying him groceries and giving him some money, and he helps the mother and her children by carrying their bags home for them. The final panel shows Max walking away, with a smile on his face, realizing the importance of empathy and the good it can do in the world."]

prompt_en:
['What concerns have been expressed by foreign countries, especially the European Union, regarding the 2019 elections in Nigeria?
Generate according to: On the 2019 general elections, Hoy also noted that the foreign countries were concerned over the threat of peace ahead of the conduct of the general elections.
Foreign Countries under the European Union (EU) have expressed concerns over the conduct of the 2019 elections considering the rising cases of killings and violence in some parts of Nigeria, notably Plateau, Benue and Taraba states.
Sir Sean Hoy, the Ireland Ambassador to Nigeria, made this known in Yenagoa on Wednesday during a call on the Bayelsa State Deputy Governor, Rear Admiral John Jonah, at the Government House.
He said that although cases of violence cannot be ruled out anywhere in the world, the recent cases of killings and violence in some parts of Nigeria are worrisome.
"The international communities, particularly the European Union, are concerned about the killings in the country and also the President of Nigeria has shown concern. I was pleased that President Muhammad Buhari visit Plateau state," he said.
"We agreed that there would always be violence in the world. But it is our responsibility, as leaders, to do what we can to reduce it and to look at the causes of violence. If it is poverty or it insecurity, we need to find ways to resolve it.
"I think most Nigerians live peacefully. And when such peace is threatened, it is very bad. Now we are seeing insecurity and other conflicts. And we think those are caused by bandits.
"I don't believe that the peace-loving people of Nigeria are involved in the violence along ethnic and religious grounds. And it is very important that leaders preach peace because Nigerians are peaceful people and have lived together for a long time. Now that Nigerians are being threatened by negative Forces, that is where all of us, including world leaders, the Nigerian people and communities, have to come together and preach peace.
"If people resist violence, it will not succeed, no matter who forced it. On the issue of politicians' involvement in killings and violence, we don't have evidence but also we are members of the international community and can't comment."
"Our concern is for the election to be free and fair and for voters and the Nigerian people to accept the result. Our job is to make the election to be free and fair. And for the people to accept it and the possibility of violence will be reduced," he said.
"But if politicians do not accept the result and communities do not accept the result, them we have a situation on our hands. Our role is to provide credible monitoring. We would have to monitor and offer assistance to reduce violence. It is important that Nigeria shows example to other African countries with the condition of 2019 election."
Speaking, Jonah said the Restoration Administration, as Seriake Dickson's government is called, declared zero tolerance on crime and criminality early on.
"You know that the fundamental objectives and directive principle of state policy as stated in the constitution demands that the purpose of government is for security and welfare of the people," he said.
"And if you are in government, you must take the security and welfare of the people seriously. Even at the United Nations level, when we're talking of security we emphasise human security and it involves access to education, health, welfare and all that makes man move on. We have moved from MDGs to SDGs and all these are directed at the developing countries for obvious reasons and in Bayelsa state."', 'Can you provide more details on what steps the international community, especially the European Union, are taking to ensure a peaceful and credible election in Nigeria?']
response_en: ['Foreign countries, particularly those under the European Union, have expressed concerns over the threat to peace ahead of the conduct of the 2019 Nigerian general elections. In particular, the rising cases of killings and violence in some parts of Nigeria, including Plateau, Benue and Taraba states, are worrying. The international communities are calling for the election to be free and fair and for voters and the Nigerian people to accept the result, as any dispute or rejection of the result could result in violence. The European Union is also concerned about the involvement of politicians in killings and violence, although there is no evidence to prove this. Foreign countries are urging leaders to promote peace and to address the causes of violence, such as poverty and insecurity.', "The international community, including the European Union, is taking steps to ensure a peaceful and credible election in Nigeria. They are providing credible monitoring of the electoral process and are offering assistance to reduce violence. The EU has deployed an election observation mission to provide an independent assessment of the electoral process and issues raised by the candidates and media. The mission comprises 11 long-term and 40 short-term observers, who will cover all 36 states of the country. The observers will assess the election based on international criteria for democratic elections, including the legal framework, media coverage, conduct of candidates and political parties, voting and counting procedures, and the resolution of disputes. The international community is also engaging with political leaders and stakeholders to promote peaceful and credible elections. They are urging politicians to accept the election results and to address any grievances through legal channels. The EU is also supporting civil society organizations to promote voter education and to monitor the electoral process for irregularities. The international community's support for the conduct of free, fair and credible elections is crucial for the consolidation of democracy in Nigeria and for promoting stability and development in the region."]

prompt_en: ['What was the role of women in Native American societies, and how did this differ from European societies during the colonial period?', "It's interesting to see how different the roles of women were in Native American societies compared to European societies during the colonial period. Do you know of any specific tribes that had particularly unique roles for women?", "It's amazing to see how diverse and complex Native American societies were. Do you know of any current efforts to preserve and celebrate their cultures and traditions?", "It's heartening to see these efforts to preserve Native American cultures. Are there any specific events or festivals that celebrate their traditions?", "That's really cool! Have you ever been to any of these events or festivals?"]
response_en:
['The role of women in Native American societies varied depending on the specific tribe and region, but generally, women played important roles in maintaining the economic, social, and cultural well-being of their communities.

In many Native American societies, women were involved in agriculture, gathering food, and preparing meals. They were also responsible for maintaining the home, raising children, and preserving traditional arts and crafts. Additionally, women held positions of political power and were involved in decision-making processes related to tribal governance.

In contrast, European societies during the colonial period often held patriarchal values, with women being relegated to domestic duties and having limited rights and opportunities. Women were often seen as property of their husbands and did not have a say in decision-making processes.

Overall, the roles of women in Native American societies were more varied and respected than those in European societies during the colonial period.', "Yes, there were many unique roles held by women in specific Native American tribes. Here are a few examples:

1. The Hopi tribe in Arizona had a matrilineal society, meaning that inheritance and social standing were determined through the mother's lineage rather than the father's. Women also held positions of power in Hopi society and were responsible for selecting the village leaders.

2. The Haudenosaunee Confederacy, also known as the Iroquois League, was made up of five tribes in what is now New York State. The Haudenosaunee had a clan system, and each clan was led by a clan mother, who had the power to select the tribe's chief.

3. The Navajo tribe had a significant number of women weavers, who played a critical role in creating beautiful blankets and rugs that were highly valued in trade throughout the region.

4. The Cherokee tribe had female healers who played a vital role in the tribe's medical practices.

These are just a few examples of the many unique roles that women played in Native American societies.", 'Yes, there are many ongoing efforts to preserve and celebrate Native American cultures and traditions. Here are a few examples:

1. Tribal museums and cultural centers - Many Native American tribes have established museums and cultural centers to showcase their heritage and provide education to the wider public. These institutions usually offer exhibits, workshops, and other programs that explore traditional art, music, dance, and other cultural practices.

2. Language revitalization - Many Native American languages are endangered or have already been lost due to historical assimilation policies. Today, there is a growing movement to preserve and revitalize these languages by developing new teaching materials, offering language immersion programs, and supporting language teachers and speakers.

3. Land preservation - Land is central to many Native American cultures, and many tribes are working to preserve their ancestral lands and protect them from environmental destruction or development. This includes efforts to protect sacred sites, protect wildlife and ecosystems, and support sustainable land use practices.

4. Native-led activism and advocacy - Native American activists and organizations are active in advocating for the rights of their communities, including environmental justice, treaty rights, and protection of cultural heritage.

Through these efforts and others, Native American communities have been working to preserve their cultures and traditions and pass them on to future generations.', 'Yes, there are several events and festivals that celebrate Native American cultures and traditions in the United States. Here are a few examples:

1. Gathering of Nations Powwow - This is the largest powwow in North America, held annually in Albuquerque, New Mexico. It features competitive dancing, drumming, singing, and showcases exhibits of Native American art, crafts, and foods.

2. National Native American Heritage Month - This takes place in November and features events and activities that celebrate the contributions of Native Americans to American culture.

3. Santa Fe Indian Market - This is a two-day event that takes place annually in Santa Fe, New Mexico. It features Native American artists selling their handmade jewelry, pottery, textiles, and other crafts.

4. Navajo Nation Fair - This is a multi-day event held annually in Window Rock, Arizona, that commemorates the signing of the Navajo Nation Treaty in 1868. It features traditional Navajo food, music, and dance, as well as a rodeo and other entertainment.

These events provide opportunities to learn about and celebrate Native American cultures and traditions and are open to the public.', "I don't have the capability to attend events or festivals, but I can provide you with information on them!"]

prompt_en: ['How does a sedentary lifestyle affect overall health?', "Wow, I didn't realize how damaging living a sedentary lifestyle could be. Do you have any suggestions on how to incorporate more physical activity into my daily routine?", "I hate doing exercise, it's boring and seems like a waste of time. Is there anything fun that I can do instead?"]
response_en:
['A sedentary lifestyle, which is defined as a lack of physical activity or exercise, can have a variety of adverse health effects, including:

1. Increased risk of obesity: Sitting for extended periods prevents energy from being burned, leading to an accumulation of fat in the body, thus resulting in obesity.

2. Increased risk of heart disease: Physical inactivity leads to a reduction in cardiovascular fitness and overall poor heart health.

3. Increased risk of chronic diseases: Sedentary lifestyle increases the risk of developing chronic conditions like type 2 diabetes, hypertension, and osteoporosis.

4. Poor mental health: Physical activity boosts mental health by reducing anxiety, depression and stress because it releases endorphins. 

5. Decreased muscle strength: Muscles can weaken if they are not used frequently, so lack of physical activity reduces muscle atrophy.

6. Poor bone health: Physical inactivity increases the risk of reduced bone density, leading to bone weakness and increased susceptibility to fractures.

7. Reduced lifespan: Regular exercise has been associated with an increased lifespan, whereas a sedentary lifestyle is linked with a reduced lifespan.

Overall, a sedentary lifestyle can lead to a variety of negative health outcomes that can be prevented through regular exercise and physical activity.', "Yes! Here are some ways you can incorporate physical activity into your daily routine:

1. Take the stairs instead of using the elevator or escalator.

2. Go for a 20-30 minute walk at least once per day.

3. Do a quick workout or some stretches during TV commercial breaks.

4. Use a standing desk, or take frequent standing or walking breaks during long periods of sitting.

5. Join a fitness class or gym and create a routine that works best for you.

6. Play an active sport, such as basketball or tennis.

7. Engage in household chores or gardening activities that require physical movement.

8. Park your car further from your destination and walk the extra distance.

Incorporating physical activity into your daily routine doesn't have to be complicated or strenuous. Small changes in your lifestyle can lead to significant improvements in your overall health and well-being.", 'Yes, there are plenty of fun and engaging physical activities that you can do instead of traditional exercise. Here are some ideas:

1. Dance or do Zumba: Dancing to music, either alone or in a group, can be a fun way to get moving and burn calories.

2. Hiking or nature walks: Getting outdoors and exploring nature can be a fun way to get some fresh air and exercise at the same time.

3. Swimming: Swimming is a low-impact exercise that can be enjoyable and a fun way to cool off during the summer.

4. Yoga: Yoga is a great way to improve flexibility, strength, and mindfulness, it can also be accessible for people of all fitness levels and can be done in a group, outside or at home.

5. Team sports: Joining a team sport like basketball, soccer, volleyball, or pickleball can be an enjoyable way to get fit and socialize with others.

6. Martial arts: Learning and practicing martial arts, like karate or kickboxing can help to improve coordination, flexibility, and strength.

Remember, the key to maintaining an active lifestyle is to find activities that you enjoy and make it a habit. By finding an activity that you enjoy and incorporating it into your routine, you will be able to commit better to a healthy lifestyle while having fun.']

prompt_en:
['Here is a piece of text: New South Wales is bracing for its first heatwave of the season, and Queensland is poised to break October records, as temperatures soar this weekend.
The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting 40C temperatures and heatwave conditions for inland parts of both states, following another near-record heatwave across Queensland last week.
Meteorologist Jenny Sturrock said the conditions were being called “an early season record”, with summer still a month away.
The heatwave will primarily affect northern inland NSW and southern Queensland but temperatures in Sydney are also expected to hit 37C on Friday.
On Thursday, Canberra airport is expected to reach 33C, Wagga Wagga 37C and Narrandera airport 39C. All are close to October records for those locations.
Sturrock said the conditions were due to a build-up of hot air over the north of the country.
After the high of Friday, weekend temperatures are expected to drop in Sydney. Brisbane is expected to reach maximums of 32C on Saturday, Sunday and Monday, and 34C on Tuesday.
Parts of Queensland have already sweltered through a heatwave that struck last weekend. Last week, Birdsville, in the state’s interior, reached 44.7C, setting a record for its hottest October day.
The bureau has predicted a hot, dry summer. Forecaster Andrew Watkins told Guardian Australia earlier there was an 80% chance of higher than average temperatures.
“You don’t often see odds that high, it’s astounding, honestly,” he said.
This weekend’s heatwave has prompted a fire warning and a message from health authorities to take extra care.
NSW Ambulance chief superintendent Alan Morrison said people should avoid the heat, especially children and the elderly.
“Heat can kill, which is why it’s so important to stay hydrated and look out for the elderly, the young and pets,” he said.

Based on the text material above, generate the response to the following quesion or instruction: What are the temperature records that are expected to be broken in some locations of Australia this weekend?', "Can you tell me more about the fire warning and health precautions that authorities have issued due to this weekend's heatwave?", 'Can you tell me more about the build-up of hot air over the north of the country that is causing the heatwave?', 'Could you provide more information about the temperatures expected in Brisbane over the weekend?']
response_en: ['Temperatures in Wagga Wagga are expected to hit 37C and Narrandera airport 39C, which are close to October records for those locations. Queensland is also poised to break October records with temperatures forecasted to soar this weekend.', 'Authorities have issued a fire warning and advised people to take extra care during the heatwave. NSW Ambulance chief superintendent Alan Morrison has urged people, especially children, the elderly, and pets, to avoid the heat and stay hydrated. The high temperatures can be dangerous and even deadly, which is why the authorities have urged people to take necessary precautions.', 'According to meteorologist Jenny Sturrock, the heatwave is due to a build-up of hot air over the north of the country. This hot air mass, combined with other weather factors, is causing temperatures to rise above average levels. The Bureau of Meteorology has also predicted a hot, dry summer in the region, with an 80% chance of higher than average temperatures. Such conditions can often exacerbate natural phenomena like bushfires and put a strain on energy and power infrastructure.', "Yes, according to the text, Brisbane is expected to reach maximums of 32C on Saturday, Sunday, and Monday, and 34C on Tuesday after the heatwave passes. These temperatures are high but not unusual for this time of the year. It's noteworthy that parts of Queensland have already experienced a heatwave last weekend, including record-breaking temperatures in Birdsville of 44.7C, which is the highest ever recorded temperature in the area for the month of October."]

prompt_en: ['Front tyre blow-outs lead to several fatal accidents involving heavy vehicles. Common for most heavy vehicles is a positive scrub radius. This can result in a destabilising steering wheel torque at front tyre blow-out. In this study the safety improvement achieved when reducing scrub radius is quantified. By using a heavy truck equipped with a modified electric power steering system it was possible to change the scrub radius virtually. Brakes were configured to emulate front tyre blow-out which appeared as a sudden disturbance on one of the front tyres. In total 20 drivers took part in the study which was run on a test track at 50 km/h. Results show that the produced average lateral deviation from the original direction was 23 cm, when scrub radius was 12 cm, compared to 16 cm, when scrub radius was 0 cm. The main cause of the observed difference was a small, yet significant, initial overshoot in steering wheel angle which can be derived from the destabilising steering wheel torque.\nCan you summarize the study on the safety improvement achieved when reducing scrub radius in heavy vehicles?', 'Can you recommend any specific actions that can be taken by heavy vehicle manufacturers or drivers to reduce the scrub radius and prevent fatal accidents caused by front tyre blow-outs?', "Can you provide me with any resources or guidelines on how to perform a proper pre-trip inspection of my heavy vehicle's tires?", 'Based on the study, is it recommended for heavy vehicle drivers to take a defensive driving course to prevent accidents caused by front tire blow-outs?']
response_en:
['The study aimed to measure the safety improvement achieved by reducing the scrub radius in heavy vehicles to prevent fatal accidents caused by front tyre blow-outs. The researchers used a heavy truck with a modified electric power steering system to change the scrub radius and simulated a front tyre blow-out by configuring the brakes. The study involved 20 drivers on a test track at 50km/h. The results showed that reducing the scrub radius led to an average lateral deviation of 16cm compared to 23cm when the scrub radius was 12cm. The significant difference was attributed to the initial overshoot in steering wheel angle caused by the destabilising steering wheel torque.', "As per the study, heavy vehicle manufacturers can reduce the scrub radius in their vehicles to minimize the destabilizing steering wheel torque caused by front tire blowouts. However, it may require significant technical changes and modifications to the vehicle's steering and brake system. Also, it's recommended to have regular inspection and maintenance of the tires to ensure their safety. As for the drivers, they can take the following actions to reduce the risk of front tire blowouts and other tire-related safety issues:

- Maintain proper tire pressure and check it regularly
- Avoid overloading the vehicle
- Drive within the recommended speed limit and avoid sudden maneuvers that can cause excessive wear and tear on the tires
- Avoid driving on rough terrain or potholes that can damage the tires
- Perform a pre-trip inspection of the vehicle, including the tires, before each trip.", "Certainly! Here are some resources and guidelines for performing a pre-trip inspection of your heavy vehicle's tires:

1. NHTSA Pre-Trip Inspection Checklist: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) offers a comprehensive pre-trip inspection checklist that covers all aspects of a commercial vehicle, including tires. You can download this checklist from the NHTSA website. 2. TMC Recommended Practice for Pre-trip Inspection of Tractor and Trailer Tires: The Technology & Maintenance Council (TMC) provides guidelines for pre-trip inspection of tractor and trailer tires. It includes a detailed checklist that covers important points like tire inflation pressure, tread depth, tire damage, and more. 3. Fleet Owner Tire Inspection Guide: Fleet Owner offers a tire inspection guide that can be useful for drivers to perform a quick pre-trip inspection of their tires. It covers important aspects like tire inflation, tread depth, tire wear patterns, and more. 4. Commercial Vehicle Safety Alliance (CVSA) North American Standard Out-of-Service Criteria: CVSA outlines out-of-service criteria for commercial vehicles, including tires. It can serve as a helpful reference to ensure your vehicle's tire meets the required safety standards before hitting the road. 5. Tire Industry Association Complete Commercial Tire Service Manual: Tire Industry Association's (TIA) commercial tire service manual provides a comprehensive guide to tire maintenance and service. It includes detailed information on pre-trip inspection, how to check tire pressure, inspecting for sidewall and tread damage, and more. I hope these resources and guidelines help you in performing a proper pre-trip inspection of your heavy vehicle's tires.", 'The study did not specifically recommend taking a defensive driving course to prevent accidents caused by front tire blowouts. However, defensive driving courses are generally recommended for all drivers, especially those operating heavy vehicles, to improve their safety skills and minimize the risk of accidents. Defensive driving courses can help drivers recognize and avoid potential hazards on the road, including those related to tire safety. They also teach defensive driving techniques, such as keeping a safe following distance, anticipating the actions of other drivers, and maintaining proper scanning of the road ahead. Additionally, defensive driving courses can help drivers understand the proper handling of a vehicle during an emergency situation, such as a tire blowout. Defensive driving courses can be an effective tool in reducing the risk of incidents caused by driver error or lack of skill. Overall, taking a defensive driving course is a good idea for all drivers, including those operating heavy vehicles, as it can help improve their safety skills and reduce the risk of accidents.']

prompt_en:
['What is the Yealink VC series, and what are its features?: VoIPon Solutions are pleased to announce that Yealink have released their new Video Conferencing range with the Yealink VC400 and Yealink VC120.
Based on the Easy Collaboration concept, the Yealink VC series allows business users to enjoy multi-point video collaboration across various web-based environments and on multiple devices with its extensive compatibility and flexible interoperability. Targeted at SMEs, the VC series ensures a perfect balance between high quality, ease-of-use and cost-efficiency.
The series is the result of Yealink’s heavy investment in advanced HD video technologies that deliver realistic face-to-face communications for remote participants. These include an 18x optical zoom HD camera and a 360-degree omnidirectional pickup microphone. A built-in powerful MCU allows 1080p video between four sites, plus 1080p content sharing.
However, even with a high-definition video and audio experience, the VC series needs no additional dedicated network (1080P at 1Mb bandwidth, 720P at 512Kb) and is supported by H.264 High Profile technology and intelligent network adaptability.
The new Yealink Video Conferencing range will benefit VoIPon customers by offering both high quality innovative technology at cost effective pricing. Yealink have continued to develop and advance their products over recent years and the Yealink VCS series further demonstrates this, said Craig Herrett Sales Manager at VoIPon Solutions.
In a further bold move to improve the user experience, the VC series delivers Intuitive Operation – a friendly UI and easy-to-use buttons allows almost all operations to be carried out in just three simple steps. This means that even small businesses with no specialized IT staff will find the Yealink VC series easy to use. Auto deployment, free USB recording, no licenses and no update costs are designed to make installation and operation easier still for customers.
VC series is another milestone in Yealink’s history,” said Stone Lu, Yealink Senior Vice President of Sales and Marketing, “It is built on our strength of industry-leading IP communication technologies and is perfectly suited for business of all sizes, especially SMEs to enhance internal and external business communications.” Stone Lu continued: “VC series not only has broadened our product and service portfolio, also means Yealink is able to deliver more diversified and innovative solutions of improving business productivity for our customers.', 'Can you provide a pricing analysis of the Yealink VC series compared to other video conferencing solutions in the market?', 'Can you provide more details about the compatibility of the Yealink VC series with different web-based environments and devices?', 'Can you tell me more about the face-to-face communication experience provided by the Yealink VC series? Does it feel realistic?']
response_en:
['The Yealink VC series is a video conferencing range that allows multiple users to collaborate on various web-based platforms using their devices. It is targeted at small and medium-sized businesses and offers a balance between high quality, ease-of-use, and cost-effectiveness. The series features an 18x optical zoom HD camera, a 360-degree omnidirectional microphone, and a built-in MCU that allows for 1080p video between four sites and content sharing. The VC series supports H.264 High Profile technology and intelligent network adaptability, eliminating the need for additional dedicated networks. The series offers intuitive operation, easy-to-use buttons and UI, and auto deployment, free USB recording, no licenses, and no update costs to simplify installation and operation. The Yealink VC series is designed to enhance internal and external business communications and is ideal for businesses of all sizes.', 'I do not have access to current pricing information for the yealink vc series compared to other video conferencing solutions in the market. However, you can check with authorized yealink resellers or conduct independent online research to compare pricing and features of the yealink vc series with other video conferencing solutions in the market.', 'Sure! The Yealink VC series is designed for extensive compatibility and flexible interoperability with various web-based environments and devices. The following are some of the compatible platforms and devices:

- Desktop and Laptop computers running on Windows and macOS operating systems
- Mobile devices running on iOS and Android operating systems
- Web browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
- Skype for Business, Microsoft Teams, and Zoom
- H323 and SIP-based video conferencing systems

The Yealink VC series ensures that business users can enjoy a seamless video collaboration experience across different platforms and devices.', "Yes, the Yealink VC series delivers a realistic face-to-face communication experience for remote participants. The series features an 18x optical zoom HD camera that captures clear and detailed images of participants, even in low-light conditions. The camera allows the user to zoom in on the speaker's face or other important visual details, enhancing the communication experience.

In addition, the series also features a 360-degree omnidirectional pickup microphone that captures the speaker's voice from any direction, preserving the natural sound quality of the conversation. This feature ensures that participants can hear each other clearly, even in large rooms where multiple people are speaking.

Overall, the combination of the high-quality camera and microphone provides a realistic communication experience, enabling remote participants to engage in face-to-face communication as if they were in the same room."]

prompt_en:
["Given the text: The sky is Infinitely blue in May.
for a celebration to wish boys healthy growth.
By law, the 5th of May is the national Children’s Day.
it’s traditionally the Boys’ Day as opposed to the March 3rd Girls’ Day.
to wish that the girls grow pretty.
to wish that they grow strong.
Also for the Boys Day, long carp-shaped streamers swim in the sky.
Carp are so strong they swim up against waterfalls, so a legend goes.
The waterfalls symbolize challenges the boys will face in their lives.
in their future like the carp swimming up waterfalls no matter how high they might be.
I remember my father erected a tall pole in the front yard.
A 5-meter-long carp streamer swam in the May breeze on the top of it.
But such a scene is seldom seen in crowded city anymore.
Only a few rich people could afford a front yard in town nowadays.
to be used for the Boys’ Day decoration in apartment rooms.
never fades away from the peoples’ mind.
Local communities fly hundreds of carp streamers collectively for children.
In town, national flags disappear from flag poles on the top of some tall buildings.
Instead, long carp-shaped streamers are swimming in the May sky.
The wish of the parents about their children never disappears from the people.
Wow! We don’t have such traditions, girls’ day and boys’ day. We have only the Childrens’ day on June First.
I see you have beautiful memories with your father, Ashi 🙂 A 5-meter-long carp streamer is a beautiful proof of love, right?
May your father Rest In Peace, Ashi!
This is beautiful, Ashi, also very moving. I enjoyed reading the poem and learning about the celebration. It is also interesting how the environment has changed since you were a small boy.Big changes all over the world, happening so quickly that we can witness them within one lifetime. Here, in Slovenia, we don’t have any such day, but I wish we did. Children are our hope for a beautiful and peaceful future.
Thank you. I’m the one who’s moved by your reading sincere reading of my words.
A lovely tradition and new to me. We don’t have anything like it here.
Can you summarize the traditions surrounding Boys' Day in Japan, including the significance of carp streamers?", "Could you please tell me more about the legend of carp swimming up waterfalls and how it relates to Boys' Day in Japan?", "Could you please tell me more about the other traditional decorations used for Boys' Day in Japan, aside from the carp streamers?", "Wow, the Boys' Day traditions in Japan are so fascinating! Can you give me some ideas on how I can incorporate some of these decorations into my own celebration at home?"]
response_en:
["Boys' Day in Japan is celebrated on May 5th, which is also the national Children's Day. It is traditionally a day to wish boys healthy growth, as opposed to the March 3rd Girls' Day, which is a day to wish girls pretty growth. On Boys' Day, long carp-shaped streamers are flown in the sky as a symbol of strength and perseverance in the face of challenges. Carp are believed to be strong enough to swim against waterfalls, hence representing the obstacles that boys may face in their lives. The tradition of flying carp streamers is intended to inspire boys to grow up strong and overcome any challenges they may encounter in life. The tradition is still practiced in many local communities across Japan, although it is becoming less common in modern Japanese cities.", "The legend of carp swimming up waterfalls is deeply rooted in Japanese mythology and culture. According to legend, carp are strong and determined fish that are able to swim long distances against the current and even swim up waterfalls. This is considered a powerful symbol of perseverance and determination, and it is how the carp became associated with Boys' Day in Japan.

On Boys' Day, families hang large carp-shaped streamers or koinobori outside their homes to represent the carp's strength and determination. The streamers are usually decorated in bright colors and patterns and are typically flown on tall poles or bamboo trees. The largest streamer is usually reserved for the eldest son in the family, with smaller ones for younger sons.

The tradition of flying carp streamers is also tied to the belief that carp bring good luck and prosperity to families. The tradition is said to have originated in ancient China, where carp were considered a symbol of wealth and success. The tradition was later adopted and adapted by the Japanese and has become a popular part of Boys' Day celebrations in Japan.", "In addition to the carp streamers, there are several other traditional decorations used for Boys' Day in Japan. One of the most popular decorations is the samurai doll display, also known as Gogatsu Ningyo. These dolls are intended to represent famous warriors and heroes from Japan's history, and they are often dressed in elaborate armor and clothing.

Another traditional decoration for Boys' Day is the kabuto helmet, which is a traditional Japanese helmet worn by samurai warriors. The helmet is often displayed alongside other samurai accessories, such as a sword, shield, and armor.

Other decorations include banners and flags with symbols of bravery and strength, like dragons, lions, and tigers. Families may also display traditional Japanese armor, swords, and other weapons.

In some regions of Japan, families decorate their homes with iris flowers, which are believed to symbolize strength and courage. In other areas, families hang traditional banners called yoroi nobori, which are decorated with images of samurai armor and swords.

Overall, the decorations used for Boys' Day in Japan are intended to represent strength, bravery, and perseverance, and to inspire boys to grow up to be strong and successful men.", "Certainly! Here are some ideas on how you can incorporate traditional Boys' Day decorations into your own celebration at home:

1. Koinobori streamers: You can hang large carp-shaped streamers outside your home, or inside if you don't have a yard. You can find decorative koinobori streamers online or at Japanese import stores.

2. Samurai dolls and armor: You can display samurai dolls or armor in your home. You can find them at specialty stores or online. Alternatively, you can make your own samurai dolls using paper or other materials.

3. Kabuto helmets: You can display a kabuto helmet alongside other samurai accessories. You can buy a kabuto helmet online or at a Japanese craft store, or make your own using papier-mache or other materials.

4. Banners and flags: You can display banners and flags with symbols of strength and bravery, such as dragons, lions, and tigers. You can find these flags online or at a Japanese store.

5. Iris flowers: You can decorate your home with iris flowers, which are believed to symbolize strength and courage. You can find iris flowers at a local florist or gardening store.

6. Yoroi nobori banners: You can hang traditional yoroi nobori banners, which are decorated with images of samurai armor and swords. You can make your own banners using fabric or paper, or you can purchase them online.

Overall, incorporating traditional Boys' Day decorations into your own celebration can be a fun and meaningful way to celebrate the strength and perseverance of boys and men."]

prompt_en: ["Write a fictional story in third person point of view about a character who accidentally stumbles upon a secret entrance to an underground world that no one knew existed. Include vivid descriptions of the environment, atmosphere, and characters encountered in this mysterious subterranean realm. Maintain a consistent pace and build suspense throughout the narrative, leading up to a compelling twist or revelation that changes the character's perspective on their own life and the world around them. Use creative language, character development, and plot devices to convey themes of self-discovery, adventure, and wonder.", "Wow, that story is amazing! Can you add more details about the conflict that Kate encountered in the underground world? I'm really curious to know what she had to face."]
response_en:
['Kate had always been curious. She loved exploring the world around her, seeking out hidden secrets and discovering new places. One day, while out on a hike, she stumbled upon a hidden entrance to an underground world that no one knew existed.

As she descended down the spiral staircase, she felt a sense of excitement and wonder. The walls were made of smooth, shining stones, and the air was cool and refreshing. She explored caves and tunnels that led deep into the earth, marveling at the strange and vibrant flora and fauna that thrived in the underground.

As she journeyed deeper into this mysterious realm, she encountered a group of people who lived there. They were unlike anyone Kate had ever met before. They were a diverse group of people, all with unique abilities and talents. Some could control the elements, while others could communicate with animals. They welcomed her with open arms and showed her the wonders of their world.

Kate lived among them for months, learning their ways and honing her own skills. She felt more alive than she ever had before, and she had found a true sense of purpose. But as time passed, she began to sense a darkness lurking in the shadows of their community. There were whispers of a growing conflict, and she began to realize that their peaceful existence was in danger.

Just as she began to participate in their struggles, she made a shocking discovery. She had not stumbled upon this world accidentally; she had been led here, for a purpose greater than she ever could have imagined.

With this revelation came a new sense of clarity and purpose. Kate realized that the world above had always felt small and limited compared to the vast and incredible realm beneath her feet. She knew that her true calling lay in protecting this world and the people who lived there. And so, she set forth, ready to face any challenge that came her way, and armed with a newfound sense of determination and wonder.', "As Kate became more involved in the daily life of the underground world, she began to notice a growing tension between different groups of people who lived there. Some believed that they should be given more resources and freedoms, while others were content with the way things were.

At first, Kate tried to stay neutral, but she soon found herself drawn into the struggle. She saw the suffering and pain caused by the conflicts, and she knew that something had to be done to bring about peace.

However, the deeper Kate delved into the conflict, the more she realized that there were powerful forces at work behind the scenes. There were those who sought to exploit the underground world for their own gain, and they would stop at nothing to achieve their goals.

Kate found herself embroiled in a complex web of intrigue and danger, constantly facing new challenges and obstacles as she worked to resolve the conflict. She formed alliances with unlikely allies and fought against unexpected enemies, but through it all, she remained steadfast in her determination to bring about a lasting peace.

In the end, Kate's efforts were successful, and she was hailed as a hero by the people of the underground world. She had discovered a sense of purpose and belonging that she had never felt before, and she knew that her life would never be the same again."]

prompt_en: ['Write a coming-of-age story set in the 1960s.', "Great story! Can you add more details about Mary's writing workshop and the other writers she met there? I'm really interested in that part of the story.", "This is great! I love the detail you added about Mary's writing workshop and the other writers she met there. Can you tell me more about Mr. Johnson's teaching style? Maybe some anecdotes about his interactions with the group?", "Hey, I like how you're adding more details to the story. But can you make it a bit juicier? Maybe Mary could have a love interest? Or could there be some drama in the writing workshop, like a rivalry or a conflict? I want to be on the edge of my seat!", "Hey, this story is getting really juicy! Can you add more conflict between Mary and Stacy to really ramp up the drama? Maybe they could have a public argument or compete for a writing prize or something? Let's make it spicy!"]
response_en:
["It was the summer of 1965, and fifteen-year-old Mary was spending her days dreaming of the future. She had big plans - she wanted to become a writer, travel the world, and make a difference in the lives of others.

But before she could do any of those things, Mary had to navigate the confusing world of high school. She had just finished her sophomore year, and it had been a tough one. Mary was smart, but she didn't fit in with the popular crowd. She had a few close friends, but most of the other kids seemed to think she was weird.

Despite this, Mary was determined to make the most of her summer vacation. She signed up for a writing workshop at the local community center, where she met other aspiring writers who shared her passion for words. They spent hours scribbling in notebooks, sharing their work, and debating the merits of various literary styles.

But the summer wasn't all about writing. Mary also spent countless hours lounging by the pool, listening to the latest Beatles record on her record player, and hanging out with her friend, Liz. Liz wasn't like Mary - she was outgoing, popular, and always up for a good time. But Mary loved her anyway, and she was grateful for the companionship.

As the summer wore on, Mary began to see hints of the social upheaval that would define the decade. She watched news reports of the civil rights movement, the Vietnam War, and the counterculture taking hold in places like San Francisco and New York City. She began to question the values of her parents and their generation.

By the time September rolled around and Mary had to go back to school, she felt like a different person. She had grown more confident, more aware of the world around her, and more determined to make a difference. She knew that the road ahead wouldn't be easy, but she was ready for the challenge.

Over the course of the next few years, Mary would continue to write, travel, and explore her place in the world. She would witness history in the making, from the Summer of Love to the Women's Liberation Movement. And through it all, she would remember the summer of 1965, when she first began to come of age.", "Sure! Mary's writing workshop was a small group of about eight people, led by a local author named Mr. Johnson. The group met every Tuesday and Thursday afternoon at the community center, where they sat at a long table with stacks of notebooks, pens, and pencils.

Mary was nervous the first time she walked into the room, but she quickly saw that she was among kindred spirits. The other writers were all around her age and came from different backgrounds, but they all shared a passion for storytelling.

There was Karen, a shy girl with glasses who wrote hauntingly beautiful poems about love and loss. Then there was Tommy, a boy with long hair and a guitar who wrote protest songs about the war in Vietnam. Robert was a quiet kid who wrote science fiction stories about robots and time travel, and Stacy was a bubbly girl who wrote romance novels based on the latest Hollywood movies.

At first, Mary was intimidated by the talent of the other writers. She had never shown her writing to anyone before, and she wasn't sure if she was any good. But as the weeks went by, Mr. Johnson encouraged her to take risks, to experiment with new styles, and to share her writing aloud with the group.

Mary's writing began to blossom under Mr. Johnson's guidance. She wrote short stories about girls like herself, who felt like outsiders in their own lives. She wrote essays about the books that had changed her life, from Jane Eyre to The Catcher in the Rye. And she wrote letters to her future self, imagining the person she would become in ten, twenty, or thirty years.
